intro: Willemetia apargioides, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Willemetia apargioides is a perennial species that is native to parts of North America.
